question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure that the code you generate is executable and can be displayed. Please help me implement this SVG image using code. The woman's profile showed a girl with long hair and a feminine hairstyle.

checklist.title: Is the SVG structure correctly implemented with proper semantic elements?
checklist.description: Review whether the code uses appropriate SVG elements (path, circle, ellipse, polygon) to construct the woman's profile silhouette. Check if the facial contours, hair outline, and facial features are accurately represented using vector graphics. Score 0 if basic SVG structure is missing, 5 if only simple shapes are used without proper profiling, and 10 if complex paths accurately depict feminine facial features and hair flow.

checklist.title: Are the feminine characteristics and long hair properly rendered?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the SVG implementation captures distinctive feminine features such as curved jawline, delicate nose bridge, and especially the long hair with flowing texture. Check if hair strands use smooth curves and layered paths to create realistic hair movement. Deduct 5 points if hair lacks volume or texture, 3 points if facial features appear too angular or masculine. Full score requires clear feminine silhouette with detailed hair rendering.

checklist.title: Is the SVG coordinate system and scalability properly designed?
checklist.description: Check whether the SVG uses proper viewBox settings and coordinate systems that allow for responsive scaling. Evaluate if the proportions maintain accuracy across different screen sizes and if the vector graphics remain crisp at various zoom levels. Deduct 5 points if viewBox is not set correctly, 3 points if elements don't scale proportionally, and 2 points if stroke-width doesn't adapt to scaling.

checklist.title: Are advanced SVG techniques utilized for realistic representation?
checklist.description: Assess whether the implementation uses advanced SVG features like gradients for hair shading, clip-paths for layered hair effects, or multiple path segments for detailed facial contours. Check if bezier curves are used effectively to create smooth, natural lines. Give 10 points if advanced techniques create photorealistic effects, 5 points for basic gradients/curves, and 0 points for simple geometric shapes only.

checklist.title: Is the code robust and handles edge cases?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common issues such as browser compatibility, rendering fallbacks, and proper error handling for unsupported SVG features. Code should include fallback mechanisms for older browsers and handle invalid viewBox parameters gracefully. Give 10 points for comprehensive error handling, 5 points for basic compatibility measures, and 0 points if no edge cases are considered.

checklist.title: Are there innovative features that enhance the visual appeal?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes creative enhancements such as: 1) Animated hair movement with CSS/SVG animations 2) Interactive hover effects revealing different expressions 3) Dynamic color variations or themes 4) Layered composition with background elements. Add 3 points for each well-implemented innovative feature (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant or unnecessary elements?
checklist.description: Strictly examine for three types of redundancy: 1) Duplicate path definitions or overlapping elements 2) Unnecessary complex paths where simple shapes would suffice 3) Excessive detail that doesn't contribute to the overall feminine profile representation. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and deduct 10 points if redundant code significantly impacts rendering performance.

checklist.title: Does the code demonstrate engineering quality and maintainability?
checklist.description: Review code organization including proper SVG structure, meaningful element IDs/classes, modular CSS styling, and clean path definitions. Deduct 5 points if paths are not optimized or contain unnecessary anchor points; deduct 5 points if styling is inline rather than separated; deduct 5 points if the code lacks proper documentation or comments explaining complex path constructions.

checklist.title: Does the visual design meet professional artistic standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the profile demonstrates proper artistic proportions: 1) Facial golden ratio adherence (eye placement, nose-to-chin ratio) 2) Harmonious color palette with no more than 3-4 primary colors 3) Proper contrast and visual hierarchy. Deduct 3 points for disproportionate facial features, 5 points for poor color harmony, and 5 points if the overall composition lacks artistic balance.

checklist.title: Is the rendering performance optimized and visually smooth?
checklist.description: Judge whether the SVG renders smoothly across devices: 1) Path complexity optimized for fast rendering 2) Smooth curves without visible anchor points 3) Proper anti-aliasing for clean edges 4) Efficient use of gradients and effects. Deduct 5 points for visible rendering artifacts, 3 points for choppy curves or pixelated edges, and 5 points for performance issues causing slow loading or laggy interactions.
